repnme.cdata!:
Togo - Technical Education and Vocational
            Training Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the project was
            assessed as deficient. Some of the key operational lessons
            learned include: 1) Particular attention should be paid to
            effective functioning of the multi-sectoral coordination
            institutions and mechanisms during project supervision. 2)
            Up-stream establishment of key procedures and operational
            manuals before project implementation will help to avoid to
            delays and facilitate the establishment of a mutual
            understanding shared by all the actors. 3) A good balance
            between support of reforms and capacities development is
            necessary for successful project implementation. 4)
            Leadership in support of changes is a critical factor for
            project success. 4) Monitoring & evaluation activities
            and follow-up of studies should receive adequate attention.
            5) Programming annual activities requires solid preparation
            and an in-depth review in order to provide a framework for
            smooth implementation of the agreed upon activities.

18151648.theme: Education for the knowledge economy,Education for all

repnme.cdata!:
Togo - Technical Education and Vocational
            Training Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project will support the
            Government's training strategy by restructuring
            technical education and vocational training systems (VET)
            and spearheading the change from a socially oriented supply
            driven training system to a demand driven system, which is
            employment oriented and responsive to the needs of the
            economy, particularly the private sector.  It will support
            development of the planning and monitoring capacity of the
            Ministry of Technical Education and Vocational Training
            (METFP) and allow it to follow the labor market trends.  The
            project will also finance the development of sector specific
            vocational training centers, which will professionalize the
            formal and informal training system through restructuring
            and reorienting technical and vocational training.  Project
            components are as follows : a) institutional development :
            strengthening METFP's Directorates, creating a Labor
            Market Information System, and monitoring the VET Reform
            Program; b) training of sector personnel; and c) National
            Training Fund : creating the managerial structures and
            funding training activities.
